alert.note: Alert for Elko; Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 15 at 5:57AM PST until February 15 at 6:45AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Elko County in northeastern Nevada... Northwestern Eureka County in north central Nevada... * Until 645 AM PST. * At 554 AM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Elko to 8 miles northeast of Crescent Valley, and is moving slowly southeast. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. This snow squall will move over portions of Interstate 80 from Emigrant Pass to just west of Elko. Locations impacted include... Carlin, Palisade and Emigrant Mine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
